mobile.description: We've detected that You are using mobile device. The template builder will NOT work fully properly on mobile devices!

description1.text: Template describes how the E-Mail sent during job application process should look like. You can either create Your own layout, or pick one of our examples. We support not only static content of an E-Mail, but also dynamically generated data based on used so called variables / placeholders. If needed You can even generate PDF from the template and use it as CV.

gdpr.main: GDPR - don't forget adding Your own data processing consent. Example:
gdpr.example: I hereby give consent for my personal data to be processed by [company name] for the purpose of conducting recruitment for the position for which I am applying.

infoText.keepInMindSet:
1. Edited advanced options are saved/used even on simple mode.

2. Incorrect usage of advanced mode can result in E-Mail being broken - use it with caution.

noResults.info: You need to either create new template, or copy one of our examples from predefined templates

leftSide.text: Left side contains components that can be used to build the template

rightSide.text: Right side contains configuration for components and email template itself

center.text: Central section is the body of the template

topTooltip.text: Top tooltip contains options to see preview, toggle complexity mode and undo changes

finalWords.text: Important: each template must have E-Mail subject & Template name defined!

description.part1: This section explains what give interface elements are for.

points.1: Edit template name and E-Mail data (subject etc.),
points.3: List of additional components to pick from
points.4: Draggable components -click and drag to the editor zone (10)
points.6: Switch between complexity modes (advanced mode has more options but it's a risk of breaking the template if used incorrectly)
points.11: Undo & redo the recently made changes
points.12: Hover / Click to see more information

description.part1: Each E-Mail template consist of multiple blocks called "components". Each of such blocks provides different functionality (buttons / links / images). In order to add a block to Your template, left-click on the block name (on left menu), and while holding the button drag the component on the central section of the editor.
description.part2: Components can be nested, like for example You can add "Section", with "Columns", and them add "Image", or "Button" to each of the sections (keep in mind that not all of the components can be nested, and there is limitation of how deep the nesting can go).

movingRemovingComponent.description: You can move the component around by holding the "drag" icon. If You want to remove component the click on the "basket" icon.

dynamicContentVariables.description: Builder provides few dynamic variables which get replaced with real content upon sending the E-Mail. You can see what the variables will be turned into by clicking on the "preview". This functionality is available mostly for the "Text" component:

usingTemplate.description: Prepared template can be used on "job results" page, the "application wizard". Template will be used to generate E-Mails for all selected offers.

warning.text: This is beta (test) functionality. The generated pdf might look incorrect - make sure that it's properly generated.

description.multiPage: Convert the template into multiple A4 pages PDF (with working page urls, select-able text etc.)
description.single: Convert the template into single PDF (links won't work etc.). The size of the PDF is never known as it depends on the content of the template.
description.general: Keep in mind that if the template contains variables (dynamic content), then only the user related variables will be generated properly. Variables such as jobOffer can only be used in job application process.
description.notAllowed: You need to charge Your account at least one time, to be able to use this functionality (generating PDF is free afterward!) - that's required to prevent users from abusing this functionality.

info.general: If You want to check how the E-Mail created from this template will look like, click on the "Send E-Mail".

disclaimer.footer: Keep in mind that the E-Mail created for job application, will contain also extra section such as footer with logo. This will not affect how the content created from the template looks like.

info.text: Here are some example templates which You can use as base for Your own template. Click use to copy the template and start using it as Your own.

predefinedTemplates.warningAfterClone: Important. Cloned template is Your to use, remember to change the E-Mail subject and the content.

message.couldNotRender: Could not render the template miniature. Your template will still be saved without it.
